Indirect tax is a tax the burden of which can be transferred to other parties. In other words, the payment can be represented by another party. title: Mid Year Population
notes: <div>The data sources used are population census and population projection. For the periods where the population census is not conducted, population projection is done to estimate population during those years. The population census is held in years ending with 0. The population projection is an estimate based on the demographic components, such as birth, death, and migration.</div><div><br /></div><div>For 2015-2019, the data source is Indonesia Population Projection 2015–2045 (midyear/June). For 2020, the data source is the 2020 Population Census (September). For 2021-2022, the data source is Interim Population Projection 2020-2023 (midyear/June). The Interim Population Projection 2020-2023 used the result of age smoothing from Population Administration and SP2020 data as the base of population, assumed the Total Fertility Rate since 2020 is constant at 2.1 (according to the Indonesia Population Projection 2015–2045), Infant Mortality Rate continuing the Indonesia Population Projection 2015–2045 results, and the 2020 migration pattern is the same as the 2015 SUPAS migration pattern.</div>

title: Population Growth Rate
notes:
Annual rate of population growth is a number that shows the average rate of population growth per year in a certain period of time. The method used by BPS - Statistics of Indonesia is the geometric method. The population data source for years 2015-2019 is Indonesia Population Projection 2015–2045 (midyear/June). The population data source for 2020 is 2020 Population Census (September). The population data source for years 2021-2022 is Interim Population Projection 2020-2023 (midyear/June).

1.The 2015 growth rate refers to the change of the population in 2010 (May) to the population in 2015 (June)
2. The 2016 growth rate refers to the change of the population in 2010 (May) to the population in 2016 (June)
3. The 2017 growth rate refers to the change of the population in 2010 (May) to the population in 2017 (June)
4. The 2018 growth rate refers to the change of the population in 2010 (May) to the population in 2018 (June)
5. The 2019 growth rate refers to the change of the population in 2010 (May) to the population in 2019 (June)
6. The 2020 growth rate refers to the change of the population in 2010 (May) to the population in 2020 (September)
7. The 2021 growth rate refers to the change of the population in 2020 (September) to the population in 2021 (June)
8. The 2022 growth rate refers to the change of the population in 2020 (September) to the population in 2022 (June)

</p><p><br /></p><p><br /></p><p><br /></p><p>
Note:

Since 2019, households are classified as having access to shelter / livable housing if they meet 4 (four) criteria, namely:

1) adequate living space of at least 7.2 m2 per capita (sufficient living space)

2) have access to improved drinking water

3) have access to improved sanitation

4) durablelity housing, namely the widest roof in the form of concrete / tile / zinc / wood / shingle; the widest wall in the form of woven bamboo / wire, wood / planks and wooden sticks of plaster; and the largest floor in the form of marble / granite / ceramic / parquet / vinyl / carpet / tiles / tiles / terrazzo / wood / board / cement / red brick.<br /></p><p><br /></p><p><br /></p><p><br /></p>

notes: <p>Proportion of Correct Handwashing Behavior by Region. The proportion here is the proportion of population aged 10 years and over who have good hand washing habits, namely washing hands using soap and running water before preparing food and every time dirty hands (holding money, animals, gardening) and after defecation and after tricking the baby, as well as after using pesticides / insecticides and before breastfeeding the baby. </p><p>Data 2018 Source: 2018 Community Health Development Index<br /></p>

title: Morbidity Rates by Region
notes:
<ul><li>Health complaints are disturbances to physical and mental conditions, including due to accidents, or other things that cause disruption of daily activities. In general, the main health complaints experienced by many residents are heat, headaches, coughs, colds, diarrhea, asthma / shortness of breath, toothache. People who suffer from chronic diseases are considered to have health complaints even though during the survey (last one month) the disease did not relapse.

</li><li>Measurement: the number of residents experiencing health and disruption of activities divided by the population

</li><li>This indicator can be used to measure the level of public health in general as seen from complaints that indicate a particular disease. Knowledge of the health status of a community can be a consideration in the development of the health sector, which aims to ensure that all levels of society obtain health services easily, cheaply and evenly. Through these efforts, it is expected that a better degree of public health will be achieved.
Interpretation The more people who experience health complaints means the lower health status of the community concerned
</li><li>Source 2019: Susenas 2019<br /></li></ul>

title: Harvested Area

Harvested Area, Productivity, and Production of Paddy by Province
notes: <p>1. The production is in terms of dry unhusked paddy</p><p>2. The main data of food crops collected by BPS-Statistics Indonesia were harvested area and productivity (yield per hectare). Production is the result of multiplication between harvested area and productivity.</p><p>3. The calculation of paddy harvested area data was carried out by the Area Sampling Framework (ASF) method from 2018, replacing the previous paddy harvested area data collection method, namely the eye estimate method collected through reporting on Agricultural Statistics data (called SP for Statistik Pertanian) by the Agricultural Extension Officer (called KCD for Kepala Cabang Dinas) of Sub-district.</p><p>4. The paddy productivity (yield) figures were obtained through a crop cutting survey on plots with size of 2.5m x 2.5m in the form of harvest unhusked paddy production (called GKP for Gabah Kering Panen) converted into dry milled grain (called GKG for Gabah Kering Giling) using conversion rate based on the Paddy to Rice Conversion Survey in 2018.</p><p><br /></p><p><br /></p><p><br /></p>

title: Production of Vegetables
notes:
1. Horticultural data collection was carried out by the Head of the Branch Office (KCD)/Mantri Tani/Data Collection Officer of the Regency/City Agriculture Service using the estimation method of field observations. Data collection uses the sub-district register and the Horticultural Agricultural Survey (SPH) entry list. Data collection is the responsibility of the Regency/City Agriculture Office. The inspection of the completeness and correctness of the contents of the SPH document is carried out by the Regency/City Agriculture Service. The results are submitted to the Regency/City BPS for processing. Data validation is carried out in a forum for synchronizing the results of processing and recording at the provincial and central levels.

Horticultural data collection was carried out by the Head of the Branch Office (KCD)/Mantri Tani/Data Collection Officer of the Regency/City Agriculture Service using the estimation method of field observations. Data collection uses the sub-district register and the Horticultural Agricultural Survey (SPH) entry list. Data collection is the responsibility of the Regency/City Agriculture Office. The inspection of the completeness and correctness of the contents of the SPH document is carried out by the Regency/City Agriculture Service. The results are submitted to the Regency/City BPS for processing. Data validation is carried out in a forum for synchronizing the results of processing and recording at the provincial and central levels.
2. Fruit crops, Marquisa and cantaloupe commodities starting in 2021 are no longer published (unprocessed)
